body_html:
Hi,

is this indeed an undesried behaviour? Looking at the code in torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c it seems like most of indexing-related functions will raise an error if called with
empty index (e.g. gather, index_select).

If this is not desired, how could this be handled nicely? I imagine simply returning
from a function if we detect an empty index is not a cool solution?

body:
Hi, 

is this indeed an undesried behaviour? Looking at the code in [torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/f608208a8051a8708e71291e84768bf8be720a1a/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c) it seems like most of indexing-related functions will raise an error if called with 
empty index (e.g. `gather`, `index_select`). 

If this is not desired, how could this be handled nicely? I imagine simply returning
from a function if we detect an empty index is not a cool solution?
